intro: Achoriphragma runcinatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has basal leaves that are narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy surface, and it produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Achoriphragma runcinatum is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a resilient species in its native range.
